instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: Hello. This board came to me with no life. Shorted 3V3 line. Corrected that problem and the board started. Everything works fine except for USB/Thunderbolt/HDMI. I have a Satechi USB-C hub here which I use on all my personal Macs and use it to test all costumer's Mac, So I know it's working fine. But on this particular board, I can charge the Mac using the USB-C port on the hub on both ports but USB/HDMI don't work. Well, they kind of work, just on EFI. If I press option during boot, USB drives mount on boot selection screen, but when the system starts loading it loses communication. If I leave it connected for 10 minutes or so, it starts loading the installer again and completes boot. Same if I start MacOS. If I connect the hub with a USB drive attached to it the system does not recognize it, but after 10 minutes connected the drive magically mounts and starts working. If I unplug it and plug it again it will work only after 10 minutes connected again. HDMI never works. BUT, with a much less sophisticated USB-C to USB adapter from TPLINK I have here, USB works on one port but not on the other. I already replaced both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> and thunderbolt controller (<CHIP>U2800</CHIP>) and tried flashing BIOS. Same thing. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message:
Did you change the USB redriver chip?
Check if get 5V on USB output, when issue appears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: What chip is that? Yes, I get power on USB, but no communication nor HDMI signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: The small PI3USBxxx, which doesn't appear on schematic, nor boardview...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: Just replaced it, same thing! Also replaced <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>, which is the BIOS chip for TBT

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message:
If you leave it stay on boot menu, USB device disappear after some time?
Do not start macOS loading.

Test with USB mouse if is always recognized before and after logedd into macOS.
Just try to diagnose if problem is related with USB 3 mode only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: I’ll leave it connected on EFI tomorrow. Problem after os is loaded happens with ISB 2, 3 and hdmi

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: Drives don't disappear on EFI even leaving it connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: Same issue starting in safe mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: Try another USB hub, just in case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message: Try known good BIOS (clean ME); make bakup first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Strange USB Problem
threads.message:
Ten should be PCH issue.
Should be good to compare diode mode readings on J3300 with good board.
